title: Police: 3 year old dies after accidentally shooting himself in Flint
content:
FLINT (WJRT) - (01/25/16) - A toddler has been killed after police say he accidentally shot himself.
The call went out over police scanners shortly after 11 p.m. Wednesday for a 3-year-old who had been shot north of downtown Flint in the University Park subdivision.
We learned Monday morning that Karmelo Johnson somehow got a hold of a handgun that was unsecured somewhere in the home. While he was playing with it, he accidentally shot himself in the head.
He was pronounced dead at the scene after an EMS crew arrived.
Flint Police Chief James Tolbert told ABC12 News the homeowners may not have known the gun was in their home.
"It's uncalled for. It shouldn't of happened and some simple common sense could of prevented this," Tolbert said.
Now the question remains - will anyone face charges in this child's death?
We talked with Genesee County Prosecutor David Leyton about the case. He said it's still under investigation, and went on to say, "No matter how the facts turn out, I implore our citizens to keep weapons out of the reach of children. To not do so can result in this kind of tragedy."
Tolbert says his investigators are working to figure out who the gun belongs to and how it got there.
